description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cntuq","text":"The Barnes Maze test is a test of rodentâ€™s spatial learning and memory abilities. In this test, animals are placed in an aversive environment (with a loud noise and bright lights) and trained to locate a hidden escape box. This particular protocol was adapted from a protocol by Attar et al. (2013) that allows for memory testing after only five training trials. The entire protocol takes 4 days:Protocol modified from: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24236177/.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":420,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"b38it","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vqst","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1enu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ohh7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"coltu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"608D5066BBC211EE9E0E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24236177"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":86,"id":438689,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"eiidq\",\"text\":\"Figure 1. Schematic of timing for Barnes Maze Assessment.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":10},{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":10}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pnpdcbnsx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pnpbcbnsx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pnpccbnsx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pnpacbnsx.webp","width":550}}}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"ci5b2","text":"Barnes Maze","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"annoo","text":"70% ethanol","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co8g8","text":"Camera and Noldus EthoVision software","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vq67","text":"Clean rodent bedding","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u072","text":"Loud white noise maker with remote control (we\nuse this one)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"fqs8o","text":"Extra bright overhead lights (we use two 3,000\nlumen overhead lamps)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87da8","text":"Plastic beaker","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EA2F34B7BC5211EEABC30A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.amazon.com/Serene-Evolution-Machine-Remote-Office/dp/B08FZSGFSK/ref=sr_1_7?crid=5B0DLVGGVFU4\u0026keywords=app%2Bbased%2Bremote%2Bcontrol%2Bwhite%2Bnoise%2Bmachine\u0026qid=1644937205\u0026smid=A11OWZFCGTC6EW\u0026sprefix=app%2Bbased%2Bremote%2Bcontrol%2Bwhite%2Bnoise%2Bmachine%2Caps%2C84\u0026sr=8-7\u0026th=1"}}}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"cra7f","text":"1. Attar A, Liu T, Chan WT, Hayes J, Nejad M, Lei K, Bitan G. A shortened Barnes maze protocol reveals memory deficits at 4-months of age in the triple-transgenic mouse model of Alzheimer's disease. PLoS One. 2013 Nov 13;8(11):e80355. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0080355. PMID: 24236177; PMCID: PMC3827415.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4c2r4","text":"Set up extra bright overhead lamps directly above maze so there is no difference in the brightness across the maze.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ceju4","text":"Set white noise maker to highest volume setting (butkeep off for now).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ove","text":"     \nMake sure there are landmarks around the room that the animals can use to orient, everything in the room must be kept in the exact same spot throughout all training and testing days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7fbe","text":"Bring mice up to acclimate just outside the behavior room for at least  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":27,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgv9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"df2fv","text":"Place fresh bedding in escape box and clean maze with  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7d7ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41A08804341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"70% EtOH","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e4ma3","text":"Place mouse in a clear plastic beaker and bring into behavior room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7e4cq","text":"Place mouse in middle of maze by flipping over the beaker and turn on the white noise maker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6v6uo","text":"Let mouse explore the maze for   (stay in the room).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3l18d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cajt","text":" After  , gently guide the mouse towards the escape hole until they enter. To get them to enter, it is often helpful to gently pull their tail in the opposite direction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ft4al","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hp9l","text":"Once the mouse enters the escape hole, turn off the white noise maker, and leave the room. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iher","text":"Wait   before removing the mouse, placing them back in the plastic beaker and bringing them out to their cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2r418","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c43ja","text":"Clean maze (including the sides and inside of each hole), spin top table (leaving escape hole in same location), and replace escape hole bedding before beginning habituation for each mouse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fjr1","text":"Each mouse undergoes a total of 5 training trials spread out over two days. Typically, this means 2 trials on day 1 and 3 on day 2. Training trials for each mouse should not be run back-to-back. Instead, all mice should undergo training trial 1 before training trial 2 starts. During each trial:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aqm7u","text":"     \nPlace fresh bedding in escape box and clean maze with   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2bbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41A08804341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"70% EtOH","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3k604","text":"     \nStart Ethovison (https://www.noldus.com/ethovision-xt) recording, place mouse in a clear plastic beaker and bring into behavior room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":36}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0A760CC5BBC611EE9E0E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.noldus.com/ethovision-xt"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1oemj","text":"     \nPlace mouse in middle of maze by flipping over the beaker, turn on the noise maker, and exit the room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8ejb","text":"Watch the mouse and record:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gf51","text":"           a. The time it takes the mouse to first look at the escape hole.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mnb7","text":"           b. The time it take the mouse to enter the escape hole (primary latency)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"383d","text":"Graph up the first look and first entry for each trial. If the mice learned where the hole was, youâ€™d expect to see a decrease in the values over time. Typically, the average latency for mice that have\nlearned where the hole is is around  . Controls for this test are distance traveled and velocity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":238,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"15ifr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1unh","text":"     \nOnce the mouse enters the hole turn off the noise maker. If the mouse doesnâ€™t enter the escape hole after  , gently guide them to the hole.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":112,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fb19l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e19mq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tmna","text":"     \nAllow the mouse to remain in the escape hole for   before returning to itâ€™s cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5btv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nfqn","text":"     \nClean maze, spin, and replace bedding before starting next mouse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0r8m","text":"The probe trial must be run 72 hours after the last training day. During this phase, the escape box is removed so there is no chance that the mouse can locate the escape hole by sight or smell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h40c","text":"Clean maze with  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"84j14","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41A08804341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"70% EtOH","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"au4if","text":"     \nStart Ethovison recording, place mouse in a clear plastic beaker and bring into behavior room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1u58","text":"     \nPlace mouse in middle of maze by flipping over the beaker, turn on the noise maker (it will remain on throughout the duration of the trial), and exit the room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16gad","text":"Watch the mouse and record in your notebook:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"109rn","text":"                 a. The amount of incorrect hole checks before the\n                     mouse checks the target hole","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69ntr","text":"                 b. The time it takes the mouse to first look at the\n                     escape hole.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1318k","text":"The trial ends after 90 seconds, the noise maker can be turned off and the mouse returned to their cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"378kv","text":"Clean and spin maze before running next mouse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekgu5","text":"Graph up latency, number of incorrect hole checks, and percent of time in target quadrant (this can be extracted from the EthoVison data). Distance traveled and velocity can serve as controls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Barnes Maze Protocol
